subject: Travel
title: The Montgolfier Balloon
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Montgolfier Balloon.

hook.text: In 1783, a sheep, a duck, and a rooster became the first air passengers in history.

buildup.text: Brothers Joseph and Jacques Montgolfier noticed that hot air made paper bags rise to the ceiling.

discovery.text: They built a silk balloon 33 feet wide and filled it with smoke from a fire.

twist.text: King Louis XVI wanted to send prisoners up first. The brothers chose animals instead.

climax.text: Two months later, humans flew for the first time â€” a 25-minute flight over Paris.

punchline.text: Humanity's first pilots were a sheep, a duck, and a rooster.

quiz.question: Who were the first passengers in a Montgolfier balloon?
options: A sheep, a duck, and a rooster
